intro: Erigeron niveus, commonly known as the snowblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron niveus is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
